page.title: 12Charity Work in Malhamdale
page.content: The people of Malhamdale as a whole are very insular.They are generous,but especially if it concerns them or their children.For example,after a local increase in the incidence of cancer,much money was raised for a new scanner at Airedale Hospital,and for a hospice in Leeds.The fund-raising events to provide Kirkby Malham School with a microcomputer were also very well attended. Coffee mornings and jumble sales are very popular and are an effective method of raising money within the dale.For instance,Airton Women's Institute holds an annual jumble sale.
